website_summaries.verdict: Available in various sizes and colors, this durable pour over coffee maker is stylish and makes brewing coffee easy.
pros: Super easy to use device can handle even finely ground coffee
Compact enough to easily store and comes with its own mesh filter
cons: It's a pain to wash by hand and fits poorly in the dishwasher
Also, the lower part of the brewer is not well insulated, so be careful with your fingers

customer_reviews.title: Has a cheaper filter than the ones shown in the photos.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Target about 1.5 years ago. (Broke it recently.) It had a very fine, sturdy gold filter. The one I received from Amazon has a cheap, mesh filter that's already a little bent out of shape. The ones in the Amazon photos appear to have the better filter( in silver rather than gold). Don't know why I got a junky one.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Pretty to look at, but not very functional
customer_reviews.text: My Bodum french press had broken, I dropped it, and I needed a new one. This was an Amazon prime day deal so i bought it. It's a beautiful design, however it's awkward to hold and pour. plastic and rubber part are hard to secure as well, if you have arthritis or hand issues you will have problems getting that on and off properly. It's annoying to pour too, no spills or anything like that, just very clunky and wide where you're suppose to grip. It's functional, for sure, just wouldn't re-buy this particular model. I have many Bodum items, from coffee to tea and I have to say this is my least favorite. I'd pass if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Karla C

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst pour over ever. Cannot get it to make good coffee. This thing in no way can replace the French Press.
customer_reviews.author: SuthunBelle

customer_reviews.title: This filter has plastic and it doesn’t say if it’s a BPA free.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the glass teapot. I do not like that it is metal on the filter along with plastic. I’m looking for an all metal or all glass filter.
customer_reviews.author: K J Smith, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Filter is Plastic with Metal
customer_reviews.text: The item description describe a stainless steel filter, but the filter is actually a plastic cage with stainless steel mesh...this means that every time you make coffee you're pouring hot/boiling water over the plastic, which can add flavor and who knows what else to your brew. Additionally, the plastic doesn't have the usual marking you find on USA made plastic so it is unclear whether it's even food safe plastic and there is certainly no telling if it is plastic designed to withstand hot temperatures without leaching chemicals. I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Not for strong coffee.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for strong coffee, I don’t recommend this. My older brother has a Chemex that we love making pourovers with, so I was looking for something comparable to take back to college in the fall. The drip rate on this product is way faster than the Chemex, and combined with the wider neck results in really weak coffee. Honestly it’s bean flavoured water. It was easy to use and super easy to wash, but the coffee left a lot to be desired. Edit: the V-60 is an awesome substitute for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Eryn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money!!! I’ve been using the pour over method for several years and am well skilled in this type of coffee brewing. I generally use the porcelain type of cone with the paper filters and you can brew a large mug of coffee very quickly. This thing is so ridiculously small, I had to add boiling water to it 7 times and it still wasn’t enough to fill a large mug. It’s about half the size that it should be. Additionally, if you prefer and stronger cup of coffee, the supplied filter and cone area is not large enough to accommodate the grinds. Shameful!
customer_reviews.author: John McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Yes
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Yes, I think the glass will break if you are heavy handed with it. Regardless, I bought the cork-banded carafe, and the straps are attached with a cord lock, which, when released, allows easy access for cleaning. The permanent filter, by structural design, is not 100% permeable, maybe you want to keep that in mind. I purchased withand
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spravka

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: Order this after trying the Melitta pour-over coffee cone brewer with the paper filter and let me tell you. This was a complete disappointment. Yes, it looks good to the eye and is easy to clean but that is about it. The coffee is well let's not even call it coffee because what you get is water with some color, but it isn't strong at all. I think the water goes through the filter way too fast not allowing it to grasp the taste of the coffee and you end up wasting a lot of coffee just to get that strong taste of the coffee. If you are into coffee that isn't strong this might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Ramos

customer_reviews.title: A very pleased coffee snob
customer_reviews.text: I cannot express with words how much I love this. The past few months of pandemic quarantine, I've found myself in a coffee slump. I just couldnt bring myself to put in effort to make good coffee. This literally sparked a coffee renaissance. No frills, just a beautiful carafe with a very fine mesh filter for good old fashioned drip coffee. I hear up my kettle and I have delicious coffee in 3 minutes. No sediment, rinses clean in seconds, looks great on your counter. For some reason it just feels good to use it. It makes me feel very intentional about making my coffee without having to put forth a lot of effort. Get this, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Aryn Geier

customer_reviews.title: Small design flaw but otherwise works well!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pour over coffee maker! I usually use Chemex but i wanted to try Bodum and my only two complaints is with the small design flaw of the spout and their weird reusable filter. Their filter leaves grounds in ur coffee so make sure u get yourself some paper filters because this is a GIANT nono. Any coffee company should know this. The spout is just a tiny little thing and doesn't go all the way down to the middle which in turn does not allow the system to breathe through the paper filter, causing it to “spit” coffee all over! Works well otherwise, but i think ill definitely be sticking to my Chemex brand from now on :)
customer_reviews.author: Arizzona

customer_reviews.title: Terrible filter, will need paper filter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old metal pourover device that isn't working like it once did. I was excited to try this one out. I made one cup of coffee with this after it was delivered, washed, and dried. Worst filter ever There was a quarter of an inch of coffee grounds and sludge in the carafe. I am not looking to buy paper filters.... It's the whole reason i purchased a metal filter!! Even in the pictures for the listing it says 'no paper filter needed'. Incredibly disappointed. It's very nice looking but the functionality is terrible. Returning this asap.
customer_reviews.author: Mia_VoxTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Filter only works if your trying to sift for gold
customer_reviews.text: I mean it's cute and all...but it makes weak af coffee. The filter mesh isn't fine enough to let the coffee steep. You end up with gritty, sandy, weak cheap hotel tasting coffee that won't wake up a fruit fly never mind chase away the morning yawns.
customer_reviews.author: K. B.

customer_reviews.title: awesome best buy
customer_reviews.text: I love pour over coffee. I used to frech press but read it was bad for cholesterol so I switched to pour over this is amazing. not too easy to clean the bottom. I just usually let it soak with hot water. hand will not fit through opening. but other than that the coffee pot is great I use it every morning. the filter is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: RIKKI F.

customer_reviews.title: Actually good
customer_reviews.text: For what this costs, I honestly wasn't expecting much but I am honestly surprised. Before I bought this I though it was going to be bad because of some of the reviews but it' really good and comes with instructions on how to use, a little scoop, and a tiny cover so that when you are pouring, it comes out smoothly. I really like this pour over and for the price I think it's a steal, I got the one with the black band.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Might think this size is good
customer_reviews.text: It’s too small, I wanted a small one because I only want one cup of Joe, but this is way too small, it’s hard to see how much you have in the thing without picking it up to see in the bottom, and the filter doesn’t filter well. And you have to pour very, very slowly. Don’t waste your money on this one go for a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: gwoodle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, easy to clean and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned two Coffee Gators and both broke, so we elected to try this one. It is so much larger and feels sturdier. I love the fact the filter is not completely metal, which should help prevent future stress on the glass (we suspect that is why the coffee gators both broke eventually). I miss having a handle, but the size of the neck is easy enough to grasp when you pour. I highly recommend this for both the price and the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim

customer_reviews.title: Tough to Clean
customer_reviews.text: This works well and takes up very little space in your cupboard. I lowered the rating, because it's difficult to clean. You can't put it in your dishwasher, so you have to handwash it, but the curved interior makes it tough to get around some areas. I use a spray nozzle from my sink and blast it good with hot water and dish soap. I love that it has a permanent filter, so you're not wasting paper ones and dumping them in your trash all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: just looks cool and very impractical
customer_reviews.text: the top lip is not made to funnel out the coffee... it pours everywhere and its terrible design. the neck hold thing is flimsy and hardly insulating and the coffee makes the pot hot and looses temp rather quickly. spend the extra money and get your self a chemex pot which works way better. this pot is the product of completely thoughtless/impractical design
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Rana

customer_reviews.title: Slow down and smell the coffee.....
customer_reviews.text: In my effort to slow my life down, I am choosing to make coffee in smaller, more 'hand crafted' quantities. It's paying off for me in a better tasting cup of coffee.....and making me slow down and take more time with life. You can actually taste the difference in this coffee maker and pot at a time coffee. Maybe too, I am no longer making a pot, grabbing and gulping. I am now lingering in the making and drinking which adds to the enjoyment. Bought my daughter one too.....so that she will start slowing down and......smelling the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent coffee! I am new to using the pour over method which does take a bit longer to setup but is certainly worth it. Using an electric kettle and ceramic burr grinder really lets you have the most control over brewing. What I like the most is less cleanup! You can use the included reusable mesh filter or just as others posted #4 cone filters. I prefer the cone filters personally and have produced some very clean cups of coffee. Absolutely no grounds leaking through and freshly ground coffee makes this a winner. The included cover for pouring fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Convenient pour over
customer_reviews.text: It's large capacity makes it really convenient to pour over several cups of coffee at once. The bulb shape does make it a little difficult to pour out the last little bit that wants to stay in there and sit on the bottom, but you get used to that. The only thing I thought was super weird was that they recommended coarse ground coffee. That'll work ok but you'll definitely have some sediment in your cup, which isn't my favorite. Instead I use a medium grind and a #4 cone filter inside the metal filter and it works out perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shibby

customer_reviews.title: Love the maker, not the filter.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. I don't love the filter, as it leaves a lot of grinds at the bottom, but I have replaced it with a Warrior reusable coffee filter, and it works quite well. You could line the filter that comes with it with paper filters, but that kind of ruins the point of having a reusable filter. I have had not problem with the glass being too thin and breaking, like a couple reviewers mentioned. It seems thin, but I wouldn't say I have been overly gentle with it, and it's held up just fine. The cork middle makes it easy and comfortable to pour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully mild coffee
customer_reviews.text: This makes the mildest, most flavorful coffee of any type of coffee maker I have ever used. It involves barely more effort to make a pot than setting up and using an electric drip coffee maker, and is much easier to maintain in clean, unstained condition. One proviso -- not really a complaint: no matter how careful the grind, a small amount of fine-grained residue gets through the mesh filter and settles to the bottom of the pot, or cup. If you, like me, want your coffee "good to the last drop" - without that final bitter residue -- then you need to put your ground coffee into an unbleached paper filter, inside the mesh filter.
customer_reviews.author: Alun Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: convenient, coffee tastes good.
customer_reviews.text: Pour over is easier to clean than french press from the same brand; because you can just tap the filter in the garbage can to dump the coffee ground. It's not as easy to measure the amount of water to pour in, but you find out very quickly if you make the same amount of coffee everyday. Some fine ground get through the filter, but that's expected. Coffee tastes as good as french press method, but you have no control over how long the water contact the coffee ground.
customer_reviews.author: Ye L.

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, got used.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker came in a condition that is obviously used but was sold to me as "new" there are water stains all over the carafe, the strainer, and the measuring scoop from being washed. There are stains in the bottom as well from liquid sitting in it. It wouldn't bother me if I had paid for a slightly used item, but they tried to pass it off as new. As others have mentioned, the metal/plastic mesh filter is very cheap and I've watched several reviews stating it's a piece of junk to use. I was planning on using paper filters, but may just return this all together because of being sold a used one that was sloppily cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Britny W

customer_reviews.title: Very poor filter
customer_reviews.text: Same as many other negative reviews. The filter doesn't allow for coffee to bloom. The result is your water going right through the beans resulting in a very weak, dirty water, flavor. I've even tried a paper filter, but it doesn't help much. I think it's the wide openings on the side as I get better results and flavor when the drop is focused to the bottom of the cone.
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our little vintage trailer that acts as a guest room. With an electric tea kettle to heat the water it's perfect. Be mindful of the size you purchase because this one in particular is small but that's what we wanted. The glass of fairly thin so I'm extra careful when I rinse it out in the sink. Love the cork/leather combo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep coffee hot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a potential option for use during camping. However, in order to drink hot coffee you have to drink it immediately as the carafe does not keep the coffee warm/hot for very long (long enough to brew but that is because the kettle has hot water), let's say 10 mins tops. The design is nice. The equipment is relatively easy to clean. Need to use more coffee grinds to brew a strong cup of coffee that does not look like dirty water, just a learning experience there as it is a cone filter instead of a flat bottom. But the fact that the coffee was warm to cool after 10 mins was not okay.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Bought Brand New, Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Update 10/7: Bodum support is who Amazon directs me to, and Amazon is who Bodum support directs me to. No one is willing to address the missing filter and solve the issue. Horrible service for a mediocre product. Ordered 10/1, received today 10/3, and as seen in the attached picture, I only received the glass piece with the cork pieces to hold it, but no actual filter... Not very helpful and not exactly thrilled. Emailed support so we will see what, if anything, is done. But I it really isn't great that, in the meantime, I have to purchase an additional filter of $25-$30 just to have one to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kitx

customer_reviews.title: Nice but hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to perfect by brewing method, so I'm finding the end product to be weak but smooth. My real problem is with cleaning it. It's too tall for my upper dishwasher rack (no, it's not adjustable) and falls over on the lower rack because it's too wide to be held by those little spiky things. It's also too narrow to accommodate a dish brush or a sponge wand, and you can't fit your hands in it to clean with a sponge or a cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective way to make coffee in the AM.
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this coffee maker. It is not quite as convenient as electric drip because it isn't ready and waiting and the small basket requires a few pours to fill the lower pot but it cleans easily and tastes as good or better.
customer_reviews.author: D and K

customer_reviews.title: Ergo is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This thing produces the expected results for a pour-over unit. It's not magic, and will not turn crappy beans into amazing coffee. I do like the increased volume, and that it seems to brew faster than my other, single serve, pour-over. Still.. the ergonomics are terrible. The orb-connected-to-a-funnel shape is just an awkward shape to hold, pour, and clean. My wife can't stand it. The flavor and process do not justify the annoying ergonomics. I wish I would have opted for a pour-over unit with a better handhold or handle. IMHO - for the price, flavor produced, and process...I think you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This used to be a fantastic product! What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these coffee markers 4 years ago, and absolutely loved it. Great quality in every way. Very nice plastic collar, and excellent filter in a gold tone. Unfortunately, I dropped the carafe recently and had to order a replacement. Thank goodness I kept the old gold filter. I sure wish I had kept the nice collar also! Neither are very nice now, are basically cheapened. The carafe itself doesn't even seem quite the same. I'm sorry I bought it. I could've just used the old filter with an old pyrex coffee pot or something. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: m-chan

customer_reviews.title: My first entry into Chemex and real coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to compare this to my mom's Bonavita, which I got her for her bday. Brewed similar coffee and was blown away with the taste. I opted to use separate filters though, instead of the metal one that's included. Am loving my chemex!
customer_reviews.author: johnyjoe2k

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed, Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 4 days of recieving. The Bodum broke when knocked over (not dropped) and when the top struck the counter it shattered. Pretty dissapointed. We've had an older pour-over that broke, but only after a year. The weight of the bottom double wall doesn't do the top single layer any favors in case of accidents. Love pour over coffee, it tastes amazing, but there's really no reason to pay extra money for a double layer if they are so prone to damage. I relize knocking it over is my own fault; but I'm leaning towards calling this a design flaw. Side note: Did not include a filter even though its pictured with one. Also dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Pro tip: use a paper cone filter and the filter provided
customer_reviews.text: I've found the best way to use this and it makes a mean cup! The key is fresh roasted beans, it is a must. My favorite ratio is 12 ounces water to three scoops of coffee. The scoop provided is basically a tablespoon. Pro tip: use a paper cone filter and the plastic mesh filter provided. Rinse the paper filter so it sticks to the sides of the plastic filter. Pour the boiling water over the grounds just to coat them and let it bloom for 45 seconds. Pour the rest of the water over and wait 2-3 minutes for it the drip through. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Bland coffee
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to actually use, but nearly impossible to get a good, strong, dark coffee. The 17 ounce one feels more like a 12 ounce carafe, and it produces weak coffee. I've had to change the brewing process to produce better tasting coffee. What I've been doing it just boiling water on the stove, adding grinds and letting it steep for 5 or 10 minutes, and then pouring it over into the bodum pot, letting the grinds filter out in the process. It's an extra step but I don't really mind it if I get my coffee in the end, I just wish it could regularly produce a more bold tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Buy for right reasons.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike if this is what you are looking for. Excellent in eb runway. Beyond adorable. No doubt this design will end up in MOMA. Our kids are away and we e do 2-3 cups a day. But for price (went through many many same brand junked out that well price...sunk costs. Design is Alessi meets knoll. We love him:)!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Eliot

customer_reviews.title: spring for the cork
customer_reviews.text: at the time I bought it, the cork version was just slightly more expensive. My only regret is that I got the black silicone version. Which is fine, but the fancy cork would be prettier. Can't bring myself to buy a whole new one just for the cork... but I'm close. also, it comes with a metal mesh filter. Don't think you're free of buying coffee filters, 100% of my brews would let grounds through. BUT, the mesh filter is still useful; I tried a brew with a disposable filter alone, and it collapsed. Started using both, and now my coffee is perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: The Adam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 17 oz Carafe to reduce the amount of coffee I drink, daily, I know, sad but necessary, for me. It's just fine for the price. I do wish that they'd made the glass a bit thicker, I'd pay a bit more for that. I love the Cork, so went with this one. The glass is as thin as the usual, cheaper coffee maker carafes and we all know how easy it is to break them by barely hitting them on even a stainless sink, so being careful is important. However, this one is the perfect size for me and I love the styling of the Cork.
customer_reviews.author: Karo56

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent for making a few cups of coffee in the morning. This is my second one and it’s comparable to the more expensive version for Chemix. If you just want to enjoy a few cups of coffee in the morning for you and your friends and family purchase this. The power of her method is interesting and it’s easy to learn how to do. You’ll be sure to find your own style and your own favorite coffee with this one. Overall I highly recommend as a first coffee maker or a seasoned coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Supergod7

customer_reviews.title: A great investment for the cost (even for non-coffee snobs).
customer_reviews.text: I’m no coffee expert but this is a great way to brew some fresh coffee. Tastes better than in our coffee maker’s brew. It’s stays warm for longer than I expected (I would say 15 minutes on the counter and it’s still fairly hot). It is thin glass so I’m always a bit on edge when I set it down or handle it. If it were to accidentally get knocked over, even just in the counter, I’m guessing it would crack or break. But then again I appreciate how light it is to lift, since I find myself pouring my cups mostly one-handed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Build quality great, coffee sometimes comes muddy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have got into the pour over hype. I have been using it for 2 weeks now and I don't know how I feel about it still. compared to a filter pour over you can definitely see a difference, you're going to have to be a little bit more coarser if not your coffee becomes too muddy. If you're a beginner and want to try a pour over system then this is great. I prefer a filter based pour over instead. Build quality is great and you definitely do get value for money so choose wisely and do your research.
customer_reviews.author: rahul

customer_reviews.title: Missing filter
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker I tself seems very nice, well made, and of good quality. However, it is missing the reusable filter as described in the product description. Trying to talk to someone in customer service is out of question (not taking phones calls right now) so my only other choice is to return the item and have a replacement sent. That’s fine and dandy, however, it has been 3 days shy of a month from my original order date and I do not want to have to wait nearly another month again. Completely dissatisfied and disappointed. 3 stars only for quality of product. 0 stars for Amazons customer service....or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.author: dawn

customer_reviews.title: Seems as good as a Chemex
customer_reviews.text: My first pour over carafe. Would purchase again before I bought a Chemex. I would suggest paper filters if you want a clean cup and easy clean-up. The hand-protector does get warm but not hot. The filter has plastic in it (although BPA-free). The filter has a couple specks of coffee stuck in it before I've got through a pound of coarse grind coffee (would recommend medium-course grind though, but will exacerbate this issue I believe). Makes a good cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pour over system to compliment your coffee journey
customer_reviews.text: If you want to try a pour over coffee process you'll be happy with this product. You'll end up with some fine grit in the bottom of the decantur but as long as you dont slush around in the pour of the brewed coffee it'll just be the stuff the goes down the sink during clean up. I decided to upgrade to a different filter and got better filtration but still end up with some grit. All in all, you'll appreciate the clean coffee flavor and know that you didnt trap good stuff in a paper filter.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Got tired of electric coffee pots failing
customer_reviews.text: In a world where things are cheaply made and not intended to use for a lifetime, cheap electric coffee pots no longer have a place in my home. I purchased this pour-over pot and it's overall much better. The cork guard is perfect to keep hands from the hot liquid inside and it's incredibly simple to use. The only flaw in my opinion is the filter area on top is too small to make a full pot at once. You have to pour, let it sit and drain, then pour again, then sit, then pour until you can fill the entire carafe. This is not a dealbreaker, but slightly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I am always been a fan of Bodum products and this one does not disappoint. I bought the 17 ounce size as this is perfect for my first brew of the day. It makes a wonderful flavored coffee, full bodied and robust. I am so very happy with this particular product. It is the perfect size. Clean up is easy. Even though it comes with its own stainless mesh filter, I have just ordered the paper filters to go inside of it for easier cleanup. Coffee is ready in no time. Love love love
customer_reviews.author: Marva Mason

customer_reviews.title: if you like french press, but hate the cleaning, get this product
customer_reviews.text: Makes coffee as good as a french press, but the cleaning is super easy, just dump the wet coffee ground to a trash can and rinse the filter. It would be even more prefect if the inner ring of the filter holder can fit into a regular coffee mug. The double wall coffee mug is plastic, not best looking but for $10 I should not complain. You can just use the filter/holder on your favorite mugs that it can sit on. This probably is the best coffee maker you can buy for $10.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Thin non durable glass
customer_reviews.text: This product is made with very thin glass. I was very disappointed to see that on its arrival. Not affecting the review but that very thin glass made it easy to break in shipping. It arrived in pieces. I would not recommend this for home use because of the durability factor of thin glass.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For those critical of the product just remember what you paid for this thing. For the price it’s a great pour over coffee maker. Does it keep it hot long? No, if you want that spend more for double wall. Does it keep your hands from burning? Yes. Is it hard to clean? With a bottle brush no. Will it make enough for 5 people? No but two people can drink a large cup of coffee and three can drink a regular cup each. If you want pour over coffee and drink it right away this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Casino Dealer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure the coffee is much better than french press or aero press
customer_reviews.text: Not sure the coffee is much better than french press or aero press, but this works fine and much cheaper than chemex. I recommend looking online for how to make pour over coffee as the instructions that come with it are not good. Helps to have a digital scale to measure amount of coffee and water added slowly. Not for a quick brew but makes a great cup.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: It was fun while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bodum product - first time I got the black version with plastic strap, this time I went for cork. The cork looks nicer, doesn't get hot so it's easier to hold the freshly made coffee. I love the design but I am disappointed that my second carafe only lasted four months - I ordered this mid-March and it's July now - before the cracks appeared rendering the item useless. Fool me once, fool me twice. Don't think I want to buy for the third time so will research better options.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: awkward coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: While there is nothing wrong with drip coffee, pouring coffee from this urn is not very practical, first because the neck of the urn is awkward to hold while pouring and holding the filter in one hand, and second, because to get the last cup of coffee the roundness of the urn makes pouring it quite uncomfortable. I do like the fact that is compact, but believe it would have been better to have an urn with straight sides instead of having a rounded.urn.
customer_reviews.author: kitzler

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity at its best
customer_reviews.text: I was lured into the electric drip coffee makers for years- more $$$ spend/ more gadgets/ more buttons/less work/better coffee myths. But when my last $300.00 machine went kaput, just weeks after warranty over, I went "old school" and have ENJOYED every cuppa joe since. This is easy to keep clean/ sleek in design/ efficient in brewing/permanent filter is easy to clean/ and the pleasure I derive from self-brewing my own coffee is immense. The simplicity of this brewer allows you to sit-pause-enjoy-savor the pleasure of both making and drinking your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: ron isbell

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was quite surprised at how well the coffee tasted. It was actually quite good and I am very picky about my coffee. I love the design as well as how easy it is to use. The first time I made coffee, I didn't heat the water up enough due to be concerned that it would be too hot, so coffee wasn't hot enough for my taste. I will correct that for next time, but if you are looking for a good coffee pot that is attractive and easy to use, this is the pot for you.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: as described, good for price
customer_reviews.text: Chemex would be a better choice. But for $22. great buy, as described, plastic filter would be better if it was metal. Be careful of shipping, received in box with other item and Amazon's employees did not put any packing material in. Didn't break, but scuffed up. Amazed it didn't break!
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: The cork one protects your hands the best while pouring hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: The cork one protects your hands the best while pouring hot coffee. Coffee inside will still get cold. You'll need a coffee mug warmer (I like the Mr. Coffee one) to use for this. It fits perfectly. The rubber/plastic grip ones do not protect your hands as well while pouring.
customer_reviews.author: veronavirus

customer_reviews.title: Simple straightforward Coffee Brewing
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of small electric coffee pots dying on me. I am also in an area where Public Safety Power Shut-offs have been happening regularly. This pot solves both issues. It is simple and easy to use.I can easily brew coffee as strong or as weak as I like. My only issue with this method of brewing coffee is the coffee cools off because there's no element to keep it warm. The carafe is thick glass. But, the coffee cools off fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: Makes a smooth cup of hot coffee in a short time
customer_reviews.text: I really love the shape of this coffee maker. I use with a filter for easier cleaning and no floating coffee grounds. Coffee tastes great, but it does take some time for the coffee to flow through the paper filter, as well I have to continually stir and push the grounds to the bottom as I slowly add water from my electric teapot. Much, much better than a french coffee press that is so messy and always full of grounds. If I wanted to scrub it and not use the paper filters, I'd probably like it more. Not the fault of the coffee maker, but the perfect pour-over has yet to be discovered by me.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Raggamuffin

customer_reviews.title: A great pour over coffee maker with permanent filter!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Bodum pour over coffee maker. It comes with a great permanent filter and, while it is similar in shape to the Chemex, it is way less expensive. For under $17, the Bodum 34 oz coffee maker comes with the filter and is easy to handle. Yes, I loved the look of my Chemex but after breaking two of them at approximately $50 a pop, I am totally satisfied with the Bodum and I trust the quality having used their french press for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a rubber bumper around the rim to prevent shattering
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it tipped over and promptly shattered into a million pieces. I did appreciate the double walled insulation - for me it's worth it to keep my coffee warm so I don't have to put it into a thermos during my slow mornings. Tip for those of you not appreciating the cheap filter they give you: order a separate one - they make really nice metal mesh ones that work for Chemex and won't fit perfectly but well enough on this guy. Will filter more finely and give you less grit than this one will.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new method to brew coffee other than the household standard drip pot or keruig and i am beyond impressed. It took some time to figure out the grind to water ratio for me but once i did the coffee was great. I went with the smalled choice being the only one in the house that drinks coffee and it makes 2 cups or 1 big cup and is very easy to use and small enough to store away when not in use. I would definetly reccomend to anyone looking for a good cup of Joe!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Blary

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little pot
customer_reviews.text: The pot itself is nice and on the small side. It takes a little while to make 17ozs of coffee in the morning using a paper filter. I used the basket that came with the pot it worked well, the paper filter makes a cup with less sediment which slows the process down. Coffee tastes nice and bold which is just what i wanted. This size is good if you are the only coffee drinker in the house. If not i would get the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Waste of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool, but don't let that fool you. The glass is very thin, I feel like it's going to crack every time I use it. It is bulky to handle and the plastic cuff gets really hot, I burn myself every time. The metal filter does not do a very good job filtering, there's always a lot of sediment in the bottom and the coffee is weak. If you buy this I would recommend using a paper or finer filter with it. It's such a waste of time, money and good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great Pour Over
customer_reviews.text: I finally dropped the Keurig for pour-over coffee and trust me it's worth it. I got the smaller of the two because I'm the only one in my house that drinks coffee, and I can still get two cups of coffee out of this. It's super easy to clean and it's very well made. I use it almost everyday and it was so worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Is bad very bad
customer_reviews.text: The glass is paper thin and they didn't package it well. I'm scared of setting it down too hard and I'm sure if they were even a little more rough when shopping this it w9ukd have shattered. I've used bongs with thicker glass than this and if you aren't careful the glass will shatter. With something this thin it's not a matter of if it's a matter of when and when this finally does break I'm just going to spend the extra money and get a chemex
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect pour over setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought some fresh roasted beans from Drip Drop Roastery (Geneva, IL - WOW great coffee) and needed a way to enjoy since I only have a Keurig. I read about pour over carafes. This is a really nice way to enjoy the aroma of a fresh pour over. You control the pour so you can get a really nice brew with lots of flavor! Carafe itself if very durable and practical yet it looks nice with the cork grip!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for pour over coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is nicely made and looks good, but doesn't work to make pour over coffee. I've tried fine beans, coarse beans, and in between. It brews too quickly, it doesn't sit there long enough to slowly drip and get flavor. It's way too watery. I even tried using a coffee filter along with the reusable filter. The filter is too porous, it would work best if there was only a small hole at the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Monika V.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever pour over, and it was so easy to make a shareable amount of coffee. Flavor wise, it was lighter than French press of course, and dare I say lighter than drip even. It is nice to enjoy black coffee because it’s not so dense (and therefore bitter) that you would need cream or milk. It also is fun to watch dripping into the beaker flask thing. Glad I bought this and the price didn’t hurt me for trying something out for the first time. The mesh filter is super easy to clean and I use it bare without any paper filters, as I believe was intended. Good.
customer_reviews.author: TXLA

customer_reviews.title: More lab experiment than household convenience
customer_reviews.text: It requires twice as much coffee grounds as a conventional drip. You need another receptacle to measure the amount of water you're adding. Coffee sludge is left at the bottom of carafe. When you remove the basket from the carafe coffee drips everywhere. For coffee aficionados only.
customer_reviews.author: MP_NY

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Really works. Use correct water temperature for the best coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I like the silicon better than the cork. Make sure you get the amount of water (at the right temperature) needed to fill bottom (if you want more coffee). Don't add extra hot water using the already used ground coffee. I used a #4 filter for easier clean up. Missing item: scoop I didn't want to return it just because one item was missing. Would like Amazon to mail the scoop, though.
customer_reviews.author: KatAttack

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but the cork/leather collar isn’t practical
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to use. I use it to filter my cold brew coffee after brewing two days in my fridge in a mason jar. Paper filters just get all the “sludge” out and this is way easier that sifting it through a traditional coffee maker. I hate the cork/leather collar this thing has. It’s a good grip but completely impractical materials for a kitchen device involving liquids! If I want to wash it I feel like I have to be careful to avoid getting the leather wet.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Me From Going To Starbucks 4x per week
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best purchase I have ever made???? I got this pre-corona to make sure I wouldn’t have to go through caffeine withdraws.... THIS IS SO EASY, SO WORTH IT. I make iced vanilla lattes literally everyday because I also bought the 4 pack of Starbucks syrups. Even my boyfriend loves this pour over coffee machine! 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to my drip coffee machine...
customer_reviews.text: [Edit] Make sure to use a coarser grind... Been wanting to get one of these for a while. My first home pour over and I can tell the difference, compared to coffee made in my drip coffee machine. This is better! Keep in mind that the cork will get messed up in the dishwasher, so hand wash only. And cleaning the permanent filter is not as easy as chucking a paper filter. Other that these points, I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Mushtandaa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tasting coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This pour over coffee maker is THE best and so easy to use and clean. I also found out they must be pretty sturdy since the packaging was TERRIBLE! I shared pics of how it came when I opened it. Surprised it didn't break during shipping! Sheesh But I will say go for it and order one because I have never had coffee taste so good! P.S. I know 2 people now who want to switch to making their coffee this way. LOL Just needed better packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a good cup of coffee, but not as outstanding as some reviewers claim. Though to be fair, what constitutes "good coffee" is a subjective opinion. The mesh filter is not as fine as expected and there are a lot of grounds in the coffee. It's necessary to make a little extra so I can pour off coffee without getting grounds in my cup. The wire mesh filter that came with my 10 cup has a finer mesh the grounds in the coffee are negligible. I grind my own coffee and have tried a very coarse grind which didn't solve that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Walt J 336

customer_reviews.title: Use a paper filter also
customer_reviews.text: Recommend using paper coffee filters. Makes weak cup of coffee without filter. Metal filter allowed water to easily pass. Definitely recommend, just recommend using paper filter together with metal filter. Been brewing pour over for years. Great product when used with paper filter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pour Over Maker
customer_reviews.text: This maker found the perfect mix of stylish and useful. I have been using it for several weeks and have not a single complaint. I really am satisfied with the coffee it makes and love the metal filter because it does not block out any of the oils from the beans.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.A.

customer_reviews.title: Darn you hipsters.....
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, bondage-like silicone wrap, wonderful permanent filter ... but could someone please explain to me the appeal of lukewarm chalky coffee? I know other people make great pour-over coffee, so I donated this to them... and I went straight back to my French press. It's not Bodum's fault (obviously, as I use a Bodum french press) but this is a trend I will gladly relegate to others...
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camera Camper

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker for students with high coffee standards
customer_reviews.text: It's made out of plastic, but still, it's the best coffee maker a poor student will ever have! Forget about overheating your coffee and wasting electricity with a regular filter coffee maker. Great flavor and the double wall keeps warm the coffee for more than an hour, without covering the top.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Crappy coffee unless you use a filter
customer_reviews.text: If you like coffee that doesn’t taste like garbage, you’re going to need paper filters for this pour over. Without a paper filter, the water runs through the coffee immediately and pours out from all angles. There is too much mesh and it’s just not fine enough. It does work really well with filters though!
customer_reviews.author: Zara

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I got did of my Keurig wanting something to make fresh ground coffee. I thought this would be a simple item to use. It takes a lot to keep this clean. Best results are when cleaned in the dishwasher. By hand with a brush doesn't seem to clean it enough. The glass seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rozic

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute, works meh
customer_reviews.text: The main problem is that the filter it comes with doesn’t catch most of the grinds. So you are chewing your coffee. I bought a paper filter to add to it, but that made the coffee too watery. The unit looks cool and people always ask about it, but other that it was a bust. Also Amazon did a terrible job shipping it, I can’t believe it didn’t brake, but that’s besides the point.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Okay so i bought this product cause the last one i had for about 3 yrs wasn't tasting good anymore, i do like the filter the holes are bigger and more open then the previous one which has a little burnt taste cause it gets clogged with coffee and the water burns it. this doesn't happen with this filter, but keep in mind if you just pour the water your coffee will be lite. the slower you pour the better. glass is also decent, the rubber where you put your hand to pour is sturdy so i would recommend this to all coffee heads
customer_reviews.author: Dman

customer_reviews.title: Coffee grounds in coffee :(
customer_reviews.text: The filter lets a lot of grounds through. I used course grounds per manufacturer directions and yet every time the 2nd cup had to be pitched because it was full of grounds. The filter quality is pretty low. And I don't like all the loose parts to keep track of. But it does function sort of and the coffee was ok but nowhere near as good as a press.
customer_reviews.author: Adrenaline

customer_reviews.title: Easy, makes great coffee, minimal plastic
customer_reviews.text: I am a low maintenance coffee person, don't need anything fancy, but my drip coffeemaker broke and I have been trying to use less plastic. This is a super easy and great tasting option when paired with an electric kettle to heat the water, despite pour-over coffee being associated with high end coffee shops.
customer_reviews.author: Ms M.

customer_reviews.title: good coffee, poor quality filter
customer_reviews.text: We bought this basically to have a better cup of coffee every morning as well as reducing our need for coffee filters. It does just that, but I'm sad to say that the filter that it came with already has warped after 3 months of continued use. It warped and the metal has detached itself from the plastic frame. We've been using a paper filter inside the metal piece just to avoid the coffee grinds from falling out, which defeats the purpose of buying this in the first place! I would recommend others to look at other pour over options. Really frustrated with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: lousy filter
customer_reviews.text: Well the pot is nice and pours great-except the metal filter it comes with allows too many grinds. So I just use it with a paper filter. The metal filter is not nearly as bad as all the coffee presses (ala french type) which makes mud. But still too many grinds for my enjoyment of a fine cuppa.
customer_reviews.author: gotart

customer_reviews.title: attractive design
customer_reviews.text: I usually only need to make one cup of coffee at a time, so I've been using the Melitta drip thingie and the brown filters. This coffee pot works for one cup and for 8 cups. It doesn't use filters, which is more environmentally sound. I just dump the coffee into my compost as my worms are caffeine addicts. Very European and sleek looking and the coffee is outstanding (if you buy outstanding grounds).
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Hartvig-Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Cork collar keeps hands from burning
customer_reviews.text: I chose this for my son in law because I am always burning my hand on the Chemex wood collar. This cork goes all the way around the glass insulating your hand from the heat. My SIL loves it. Easy to clean. He avoids the filter it came with because there is a lot of plastic. Got him the Chemex paper filters that don't require any filter stand.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Walker

customer_reviews.title: An easy path to great-tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to beat the Bodum for quick, excellent coffee without the bulk of an electronic coffee maker. Boil water (we use an electric kettle), grind fresh coffee, and slowly pour over the top. That's it. The included metal filter works great, and the Bodum is easy to clean if you own a bottle brush already. My husband and I switched to pour-over coffee brewing a few years ago when our electronic coffee maker died suddenly one morning, and we've never looked back. The flavor is so much better this way, and it takes less than 5 min to brew 2 or 3 mugs worth of excellent coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pour over
customer_reviews.text: Bodum is a well-known brand so I was expecting a good quality product. The item is great and really easy to use. You'd need a bottle brush or similar to clean the insides though. I took off one star because the cork was shedding when we first got it. It stopped shedding after a couple of uses. If that's a chore to you, you could consider the silicon ones instead.
customer_reviews.author: P Then

customer_reviews.title: Need to use a paper filter to perfect the coffee flavor and overall experience
customer_reviews.text: I always want to try pour over coffee. Bodum is always been my favorite brand for coffee related accessories. However, I am a bit disappointed with the pour coffee device. The filter is a bit too wide as the flavor is not so strong, drip really fast and difficult to clean. However, cleaning is easy if you use a paper filter along with the filter, and flavor improved as well. Overall high quality materials, still a solid made product.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile IT Force

customer_reviews.title: Basically a cheaper Chemex
customer_reviews.text: Functionally, it works the same as a Chemex and its significantly cheaper. The glass doesn't feel like it will withstand too many hard knocks, so a bit of care will help you avoid buying more than one. The built in filter is so so. To avoid fine sediment I still use a paper filter, but it works all by itself in a pinch. Easy to clean, makes a fine cup of Joe, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great carafe terrible filter
customer_reviews.text: I broke my Coffee Gator carafe. I decided to get a Bodum coffee maker because the carafe looked better. I was right the carafe is great to hold and clean. The problem is the filter stinks it may filter beans but not coarse ground coffee. There was much to much coffee grinds in the cup. Lucky for me I had my old Coffee Gator filter and it works great with my new carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: not great, do not plan on strong coffee without grit
customer_reviews.text: ok, design flawed for coffee filter if you like strong coffee. changing the grind to a finer grind to slow the drip process, allows grounds to filter into coffee. Using paper filters with the enclosed filter does not work well, coffee then cold. there are better options for this type of coffee “maker”. do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pouring hot water over medium ground coffee, far far away from children, babies, cute rabbit bunnies and silly scampering kittens. Once done I drink said coffee and reminisce about how I didn't harm babies, cute cuddly kiddy bunnies and butterflies amass around me as the rainbow of flovor passes and warms my espoagus.
customer_reviews.author: Off The Beaten Path

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Buy this product. Now. There is a huge difference between a pour over and drip coffee. I purchased paper filters to go with this since the mesh filter still lets some coffee beans go through. Besides that, the taste is amazing. I purchase different kinds of coffee beans all around it this has made a huge difference. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Toua

product_meta.title: Bodum Pour Over Coffee Maker with Permanent Filter, 1 Liter, 34 Ounce, Black Band
product_meta.description: Size:34 Ounce| Color:BlackThe pour over promises excellent, rich taste and robust aroma while maintaining the natural oils of the ground Coffee. For the perfect cup of Coffee, simply fill the cone-shaped filter with freshly ground Coffee and pour a small amount of heated water over them until soaked. Slowly pour the remaining hot water into the filter. Coffee will drip into the mouth-blown, borosilicate glass carafe and, in 3-4 minutes, will be ready to serve. Remove the filter from the carafe before serving and enjoy!
feature_bullets: Pour over Coffee: manual pour over Coffee maker allows you to brew an excellent cup of Coffee in minutes
Stainless steel: includes a Permanent, stainless steel mesh filter that helps extract your coffee's aromatic oils and subtle flavors instead of being absorbed by a paper filter
Coffee carafe: made of durable, heat-resistant borosilicate glass with color band detailing that is both functional and elegant
Quick and easy: simply add coarse ground Coffee to filter, pour a small amount of water in a circular motion over ground Coffee until soaked then add the remaining water and let drip
Servings: pour over Coffee maker makes 8 cups of Coffee, 4 oz. each; dishwasher safe
